class_notes:
This course is an introduction to the field of Medical Anthropology; it is a general survey. The course provides an anthropological perspective on the cultural features of different medical systems, illness experience, mental health, and the enculturation of medical practitioners.
The anthropological perspective on medicine, illness and healing emphasizes six things: 1. cross-cultural comparisons of diverse medical system; 2. the cultural construction of health and illness; 3. the concept of adaptation in biocultural evolution; 4. critical medical anthropology of the culture of biomedicine; 5. ethnicity and health care; 6. Cross-cultural communication in health care; 7. Illness experience of disability, stigma and psychosocial stress. The course emphasizes the practical uses of such perspectives in the improvement of health care.
course_description: Comparative study of disease ecology and medical systems of other cultures; sociocultural factors affecting contemporary world health problems; cultural aspects of ethnomedicine and biomedicine; ethnicity and health care.
